product_name: L'angeLe Duo Flex 360° Airflow Titanium Styler
summary: SummaryEffortlessly achieve your every curl desire! L'Ange Le Duo Flex goes beyond traditional curlers with its unprecedented flexibility and precision. Designed with style-locking cooling vents, this easy-to-use curler has the flexibility to create loose or tight curls with a simple toggle switch.
details: DetailsBenefitsCurved titanium plates help define curls while an enhanced ion generator reduces frizz and boosts shineVersatility & flexibility for every styleInnovative, long-lasting curlsProfessional-Quality ResultsFeaturesTitanium Plates360° AirflowDual Styling OptionsItem 2641963How To UseStart with hair that is completely dried & detangled before using Le Duo Flex.When initially plugged into an electrical outlet, the lights on the tool will illuminate in succession from the icon to the highest temperature (the tool has not started heating).To heat Le Duo Flex for the first time, press and hold the power button until a white light illuminates beside 280°F.The light beside the default temperature of 280°F will blink while the tool heats. Once the tool has reached temperature, the white light beside the temperature will stop blinking and the fan will turn on automatically.To select a different temperature, press and release the power button until the light beside your desired temperature illuminates.To deactivate the fan, press and release the button.Apply your L'ange heat protectant of choice.Detangle and divide hair into small, manageable sections.Make sure to keep the hot plates away from your face and body.For tight curls, toggle the adjustor switch---found above the clip---towards the symbol. For loose curls, toggle the adjustor switch towards the symbol.Holding the iron vertically, squeeze the clip to open the plates and insert a 1⁄2"--1" section of hair between the plates near the root.Close iron, rotate between 180° and 360°---the more rotation, the tighter the curl---making sure that you turn the tool in the direction of the curve of the plate. Glide the iron down the length of the hair. The slower you pull the iron, the tighter the curl. Consider varying the curl direction for a more natural end result.Repeat on remaining sections until your desired style is achieved.Once finished, press and hold the power button for 3 seconds to turn the tool OFF. All lights on the handle will turn off.Unplug Le Duo Flex and wait until completely cooled before storing away.Tip: To ensure a smooth glide, always turn the iron in the direction of the curve of the plate.Shipping & Coupon RestrictionsThis brand is excluded from most Ulta Beauty coupons.See brand eligibility details
how_to_use: Start with hair that is completely dried & detangled before using Le Duo Flex.When initially plugged into an electrical outlet, the lights on the tool will illuminate in succession from the icon to the highest temperature (the tool has not started heating).To heat Le Duo Flex for the first time, press and hold the power button until a white light illuminates beside 280°F.The light beside the default temperature of 280°F will blink while the tool heats. Once the tool has reached temperature, the white light beside the temperature will stop blinking and the fan will turn on automatically.To select a different temperature, press and release the power button until the light beside your desired temperature illuminates.To deactivate the fan, press and release the button.Apply your L'ange heat protectant of choice.Detangle and divide hair into small, manageable sections.Make sure to keep the hot plates away from your face and body.For tight curls, toggle the adjustor switch---found above the clip---towards the symbol. For loose curls, toggle the adjustor switch towards the symbol.Holding the iron vertically, squeeze the clip to open the plates and insert a 1⁄2"--1" section of hair between the plates near the root.Close iron, rotate between 180° and 360°---the more rotation, the tighter the curl---making sure that you turn the tool in the direction of the curve of the plate. Glide the iron down the length of the hair. The slower you pull the iron, the tighter the curl. Consider varying the curl direction for a more natural end result.Repeat on remaining sections until your desired style is achieved.Once finished, press and hold the power button for 3 seconds to turn the tool OFF. All lights on the handle will turn off.Unplug Le Duo Flex and wait until completely cooled before storing away.Tip: To ensure a smooth glide, always turn the iron in the direction of the curve of the plate.

faceoff_positive.comments: L'ange will always be my favorite brand for curling tools. The Flex still gives great curls'"though I almost feel like the "tight" setting gave me looser curls, and the "loose" setting gave me tighter ones! Either way, the curls looked great. Two downsides to the Flex are the high-pitched fan noise and the occasional finger burns. With the Classic, you can touch it anywhere'"it's super safe, especially for someone just learning how to curl their hair. I have the Classic Duo and Classic Grande, and the fans on both of those are much quieter'"more of a soft hum. The Flex has a noticeably high-pitched sound in comparison. Still, I highly recommend any of these tools!
faceoff_positive.headline: Love all L'ange

faceoff_negative.comments: Having so many products from L'ange I was excited to get this one too. Unfortunately, it is a poor design. It's a great concept, but does not deliver as advertised. On the highest setting the plates were barely warm. It never got warm enough to wave or curl my hair. Maybe mine was just defective. I could still touch the plates (they were barely warm) on the highest setting. Sadly, I had to send it back. I do feel the barrel needs to be longer, and the curved plate design does not hold even the smallest amount of hair well enough to produce results.
faceoff_negative.headline: Horrible. Poor design and performance
